alert.note: Alert for Collingsworth; Wheeler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 20 at 2:48AM CST until February 20 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SOUTHEASTERN TEXAS PANHANDLE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SOUTHEASTER TEXAS PANHANDLE... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM this morning to 7 PM CST this evening. * Affected Area...In Texas...Wheeler and Collingsworth. * 20 Foot Winds...Southwest 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 25 mph Sunday. Southwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph Monday. * Relative Humidity...As low as 7 percent both Sunday and Monday. * Red Flag Threat Index...3 to 4 on Sunday and 5 to 6 on Monday. * Timing...Late morning through early evening.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks. A Fire Weather Watch means that the potential for critical fire weather conditions exists. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
